intro: Mosiera cabanasensis subsp. cabanasensis, commonly known as the Cabanasensis mosiera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
